intro: Thujopsis dolabrata var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf western arborvitae, is a deciduous conifer native to the western United States. It is characterized by its flat, linear leaves that are arranged in a flat spray, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow-green flowers followed by winged seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for landscaping in suitable climates. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
